header_summary: Two papers criticized for unrealistic assumptions about Bitcoin's security model and compromise of security.Bitcoin's security relies on maintaining a nash equilibrium between miners, requiring a change in proof-of-work algorithm if compromised.LN-like protocols with sufficient CSV can prevent attacks; BIP updated to incorporate DH cryptosystem.Discussion focuses on deanonymizing techniques on LN, role of blinded paths, and privacy implications.

recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Two papers criticized for incorrect assumptions about Bitcoin's security model and its compromises.
- Assumption of oracles and altchains enabling trustless payments is unrealistic, compromising security.
- Maintaining nash equilibrium between miners is crucial for Bitcoin's security and preventing censorship.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP has been updated to include a DH cryptosystem and a public key.
- This change was made in response to Adam's comments.
- The goal is to provide a secure experience without risking loss of funds.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests that the URI version of base64 is more recommended.
- QR codes treat them as binary data, so either option will double the density.
- UR encoding is efficient with QR codes and can be animated for large data.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- The email proposes making classic keysend into MPP for post-PTLCs scenario.
- CLN and LDK already support MPP and it would be helpful if others did too.
- Senders consider payment claimed once it's sent, even if recipient claims less.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Tony explains that deanonymizing techniques on the Lightning Network only deanonymize the recipient.
- Bastien argues that while mobile wallet users can be identified, blinded paths can help preserve privacy.
- The discussion explores the risks and benefits of deanonymizing techniques and the role of blinded paths.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been documenting their bi-weekly specification meetings this year.
- The records are shared online for others to access at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification.
- Gurwinder manually verifies the accuracy of the transcripts for Chaincode.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server will be fully 'blinded' and will not learn the necessary information.
- The protocol involves key and nonce generation, signing, and aggregation of signatures.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new second-layer protocol that offers an alternative to the Lightning network.
- Unlike Lightning, Ark uses virtual UTXOs and does not require opening and closing channels.
- Ark enables off-chain payments through an untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets can be compromised or lost, leading to toxic data and lost funds.
- Silent Payments allow safe multiple payments, but addresses should eventually expire.
- Adding a 3 byte or 2 byte field can encode expiration date to avoid harmful mistakes.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit allowing attackers to create balances through invoice manipulation.
- Users should update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to protect against similar attacks.
- Developers should implement additional checks to prevent invoice tampering and make preimage hash terminology explicit.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan to conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
